title: Health Check-Ups
description: Preventative care is the best care. Regular health check-ups help you stay on top of your health, catch potential issues early, and build a relationship with your doctor.
sentences: Schedule an annual physical with your general practitioner.
Visit the dentist for a cleaning and check-up every 6-12 months.
Get your eyes checked every 1-2 years, even if you don't wear glasses.
Know your key numbers: blood pressure, cholesterol, and blood sugar.
Keep a record of your family's medical history.
dos: Prepare a list of questions and concerns before your doctor's appointment.
Be honest and open with your doctor about your lifestyle and symptoms.
Follow through on recommended tests and follow-up appointments.
Know what your health insurance covers.
donts: Don't ignore persistent or unusual symptoms.
Don't self-diagnose using the internet; consult a professional.
Don't skip appointments because you feel healthy.
Don't be afraid to get a second opinion.
